titles.ar: باب أَنَّ الْمِيرَاثَ لِمَنْ سَبَقَ إِلَى سَهْمِ قَرِيبِهِ وَ أَنَّ ذَا السَّهْمِ أَحَقُّ مِمَّنْ لَا سَهْمَ لَهُ
titles.en: Chapter 2 – The inheritance is for the one who precedes to a share of his near ones, and that the the one with a (legislated) share is more deserving than the one who has no (legislated) share for him

titles.ar: باب أَنَّ الْفَرَائِضَ لَا تُقَامُ إِلَّا بِالسَّيْفِ
titles.en: Chapter 3 – The The Obligations cannot be established except by the sword

titles.ar: باب أَنَّ الْمِيرَاثَ لِمَنْ سَبَقَ إِلَى سَهْمِ قَرِيبِهِ وَ أَنَّ ذَا السَّهْمِ أَحَقُّ مِمَّنْ لَا سَهْمَ لَهُ
titles.en: Chapter 2 – The inheritance is for the one who precedes to a share of his near ones, and that the the one with a (legislated) share is more deserving than the one who has no (legislated) share for him

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/119)

narrator_chain.text: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سَمَاعَةَ وَ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنَّ فِي كِتَابِ عَلِيٍّ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ كُلَّ ذِي رَحِمٍ بِمَنْزِلَةِ الرَّحِمِ الَّذِي يَجُرُّ بِهِ إِلَّا أَنْ يَكُونَ وَارِثٌ أَقْرَبَ إِلَى الْمَيِّتِ مِنْهُ فَيَحْجُبَهُ .

en.hubeali: Humeyd Bin iyad, from Al Hassan Bin Muhammad Bin Sama’at and a number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad and Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, altogether from Ibn Mahboub, from Abu Ayoub Al Khaza,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘In the Book of Ali<sup>asws</sup> is that: ‘Every one with a womb relationship is at the status of the womb which he flows with except if there happens to be an inheritor closer to the deceased than him, so he supersedes him’.
en.sarwar: 1. Humayd ibn Ziyad has narrated from al-Hassan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama‘ah and a number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad and Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad all from ibn Mahbub from abu Ayyub al-Khazzaz who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that it is in the book of Ali, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, that every relative is like the kinship and womb that has established such relation unless there is one who is closer to the deceased than him who then becomes a barrier.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/119)

narrator_chain.text: ابْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ أَبِي يُوسُفَ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كَانَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِذَا كَانَ وَارِثٌ مِمَّنْ لَهُ فَرِيضَةٌ فَهُوَ أَحَقُّ بِالْمَالِ .

en.hubeali: Ibn Mahboub, from Hammad Abu Yusuf Al Khaaz, from Suleyman Bin Khalid,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘When there was an inheritor from the one for him is an Obligation (legislated share), so he is more deserving of the wealth’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ibn Mahbub from Hammad abu Yusuf al-Khazzaz from Sulayman ibn Khalid who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that ’ Amir al-Mu’minin would say, ‘An heir who has an ordained share is more deserving of the legacy.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/119)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قَالَ إِذَا الْتَفَّتِ الْقَرَابَاتُ فَالسَّابِقُ أَحَقُّ بِمِيرَاثِ قَرِيبِهِ فَإِنِ اسْتَوَتْ قَامَ كُلٌّ مِنْهُمْ مَقَامَ قَرِيبِهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Yunus, from a man,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>: ‘When the relatives are turned, so the one who is more deserving of the inheritance is his closest relative. So they are equal, each one from them would be made to stand at the place of his closeness (of relationships)’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus from a man who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘When relations overlay each other then the earliest is more deserving of legacy of his relative, and if they are equal then each one takes the place of one who is close to him.’”
